verses.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥
verses.transliteration: karmaṇy-evādhikāras te mā phaleṣhu kadāchana, mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo 'stvakarmaṇi
verses.translation: You have the right to perform your duty, but you are not entitled to the fruits of action. Never consider yourself the cause of the results of your activities, and never be attached to not doing your duty.
verses.context: This is the most famous verse from the Gita, teaching karma yoga - selfless action without attachment to results.

verses.sanskrit: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय। सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते॥
verses.transliteration: yoga-sthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā dhanañjaya, siddhy-asiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṁ yoga uchyate
verses.translation: Perform your duty equipoised, O Arjuna, abandoning all attachment to success or failure. Such equanimity is called Yoga.
verses.context: Teaches the importance of emotional balance and detachment from outcomes.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते। तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम्॥
verses.transliteration: buddhi-yukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛita-duṣhkṛite, tasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśhalam
verses.translation: One who is united in intelligence abandons both good and bad deeds. Therefore, strive for Yoga, which is the art of working skillfully.
verses.context: Addresses making decisions with clarity and wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ। ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि॥
verses.transliteration: sukha-duḥkhe same kṛitvā lābhālābhau jayājayau, tato yuddhāya yujyasva naivaṁ pāpam avāpsyasi
verses.translation: Fight for the sake of duty, treating alike happiness and distress, loss and gain, victory and defeat. Fulfilling your responsibility in this way, you will never incur sin.
verses.context: Teaches how to maintain inner peace regardless of external circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत। अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम्॥
verses.transliteration: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārata, abhyutthānam adharmasya tadātmānaṁ sṛijāmyaham
verses.translation: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjuna, at that time I manifest myself on earth.
verses.context: Krishna promises divine intervention when dharma declines, offering comfort in difficult times.

verses.sanskrit: तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया। उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः॥
verses.transliteration: tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśhnena sevayā, upadekṣhyanti te jñānaṁ jñāninas tattva-darśhinaḥ
verses.translation: Learn the truth by approaching a spiritual master. Inquire from him with reverence and render service unto him. The self-realized souls can impart knowledge unto you.
verses.context: Emphasizes the importance of humility in learning and seeking guidance.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि। ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni chātmani, īkṣhate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśhanaḥ
verses.translation: The true yogis, uniting their consciousness with God, see every living being with equal vision. They see themselves in all beings, and all beings in themselves.
verses.context: Teaches the vision of oneness and universal love.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः। तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर॥
verses.transliteration: yajñārthāt karmaṇo 'nyatra loko 'yaṁ karma-bandhanaḥ, tad-arthaṁ karma kaunteya mukta-saṅgaḥ samāchara
verses.translation: Work done as a sacrifice for the Supreme binds one not. Therefore, O son of Kunti, perform your prescribed duties for His satisfaction, and in that way you will always remain free from bondage.
verses.context: Explains how work becomes worship when done selflessly.

verses.sanskrit: न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचिन्नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः। अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे॥
verses.transliteration: na jāyate mriyate vā kadāchin nāyaṁ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ, ajo nityaḥ śhāśhvato 'yaṁ purāṇo na hanyate hanyamāne śharīre
verses.translation: The soul is never born and never dies. It is unborn, eternal, ever-existing and primeval. It is not slain when the body is slain.
verses.context: Teaches about the eternal nature of the soul, removing fear of death.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śharaṇaṁ vraja, ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣhayiṣhyāmi mā śhuchaḥ
verses.translation: Abandon all varieties of dharmas and simply surrender unto Me alone. I shall liberate you from all sinful reactions; do not fear.
verses.context: The final teaching of the Gita - complete surrender and trust in the divine.
